required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Clinical Investigation to Evaluate Clinical Performance, Safety and Patient Reported Outcomes of an Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Open, Long-term Clinical Investigation Evaluating Safety, Performance and Patient Reported Outcomes With an Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System in Adult Subjects With Conductive Hearing Loss, Mixed Hearing Loss or Single-sided Sensorineural Deafness.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this clinical investigation is to collect long-term safety and performance data with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System by following subjects from the previous Osia clinical investigation CBAS5751. In addition, questions regarding device satisfaction, sound satisfaction, usability and health care utilisation will be asked.

primary_outcome.measure: Number and type of reported Adverse events
primary_outcome.description: The adverse events are collected from the participant's last visit in study CBAS5751 (6 months post-surgery) and categorized by system organ class system

primary_outcome.measure: Number and type of reported Device deficiencies
primary_outcome.description: The device deficiencies are collected from the participant's last visit in study CBAS5751 (6 months post-surgery) and categorized by relationship
Concomitant medication are collected from the participant's last visit in study CBAS5751 (6 months post-surgery)

primary_outcome.measure: Socio-economic health care data via the Client Service Receipt Inventory (CSRI) survey
primary_outcome.description: Demographic data (marital status, cohabitation, usual place of residence, education level), employment status, Healthcare utilization and Hearing rehabilitation data are collected

primary_outcome.measure: Socio-economic health care data via the Client Service Receipt Inventory (CSRI) survey
primary_outcome.description: Demographic data (marital status, cohabitation, usual place of residence, education level), employment status, Healthcare utilization and Hearing rehabilitation data are collected

primary_outcome.measure: Change in audiometric thresholds with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 months post-surgery and 24 months post-surgery compared to preoperative thresholds via an audiogram
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline before surgery, 12 months and 24 months post-surgery
primary_outcome.description: Bone- and air conduction thresholds, masked and unmasked

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hearing performance with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 months and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study assessed via audiometric thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Sound-field (Pure Tone Average 4, mean of 0.5, 1, 2 and 4 kHz)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hearing performance with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study assessed via audiometric thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hearing performance with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study assessed via adaptive speech recognition in noise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Speech-to-noise ratio, 50% speech understanding

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in hearing performance with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study assessed via Bone Conduction (BC) direct
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in self-reported hearing outcome with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit (APHAB) questionnaire. APHAB produces a global score and scores for four subscales: Ease of Communication, Reverberation, Background Noise, and Aversiveness. Global score is the average of all subscales. All scales range from 0-100%, where 0% indicates no problem and 100% indicates always problem. A decrease in the APHAB values indicates an improvement. The difference in scores will be presented. A positive value indicates an improvement, a negative value an impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported hearing outcome with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via the Speech, Spatial and Qualities of Hearing Scale (SSQ) questionnaire. Measuring change of speech, spatial and hearing experiences with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System. The Total score summarizes the parameters speech, spatial and hearing. A scale from 0 to 10 is used, where 0 represents "can not hear at all", and 10 "hear perfectly". An increase of an SSQ value reflects an improvement. The change in scores will be presented. A positive value indicates improved hearing, a negative value indicates impaired hearing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in health-related quality of life with the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via the Health Utilities Index (HUI) questionnaire. Change of health status and health related quality of life using the generic quality of life scale Health Utilities Index when wearing the Active Osseointegrated Steady-State Implant System. A health utility value of 1.00 indicates perfect health while a score of 0.00 indicates death. The change in scores will be presented. A positive value indicates an improved quality of life, a negative value indicates impaired quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (every-day situation and self-esteem) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 7, where 1 represent Much worse and 7 represent Much better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (easiness to use) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 5 where 1 represent Very difficult and 5 represent Very easy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (durability of the device and sound quality) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 5, where 1 represent Very dissatisfied and 5 represent Very satisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (overall satisfaction) with question Yes/No.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (every-day situation and self-esteem) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 7, where 1 represent Much worse and 7 represent Much better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (easiness to use) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 5 where 1 represent Very difficult and 5 represent Very easy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (durability of the device and sound quality) assessed on a Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To express how much they agree or disagree with a particular statement. The scale goes from 1 to 5, where 1 represent Very dissatisfied and 5 represent Very satisfied.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant satisfaction with the investigational device (overall satisfaction) with question Yes/No.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily use of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Average hours of daily use during the last week before each follow up visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in daily streaming time of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Average hours of daily streaming during the last week before each follow up visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in battery lifetime of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Average hours of battery lifetime for a single battery during the last week before each follow up visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in magnet choice of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Magnet strength ranging from 1 to 4, strength 1 being the weakest and 4 the strongest. If the magnet strength has been changed the reason for change is captured in free text

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in use of SoftWear pad for the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: SoftWear pad usage: Yes or No

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in retention of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) 100 mm where 0 mm represents insufficient retention and 100 mm excellent retention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in wearing comfort of the Osia 2 sound processor at 12 and 24 months post-surgery compared to last performed measurement (3 or 6 months) in the CBAS5751 study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 or 6 months post-surgery, 12 and 24 months post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) 100 mm where 0 mm represents no comfort at all and 100 mm excellent comfort.

intervention.description: System includes the OSI200 implant surgically placed under the skin behind the ear, the BI300 implant osseointegrated in the bone and the external Osia 2 sound process

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has performed Hearing assessment at 3 and/or 6 months in the clinical investigation CBAS5751
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to follow investigational procedures, e.g. to complete quality of life scales, or unwilling to comply with the requirements of the clinical investigation as determined by the investigator
- Use of ototoxic drugs that could be harmful to the hearing, as judged by the investigator

facility.name: Department of Otorhinolaryngology, Head and Neck Surgery Faculty of Medicine. The Chinese University of Hong Kong

patient_data.ipd_description: Cochlear do not have an approved platform for public sharing of IPD collected in this study. Data may be provided to individual researchers on request.
